Since f5521c33f9094f2f1e416764c4d2020237d65bc6 was already merged into v1.3.x, you can rebase this PR back to the head of v1.3.x and only include 15b27bdacc2d4a29b1a2d95b9a89ec10f2d2f4d4 in this PR to get tests running.

@apolcyn can you confirm you are OK with 1.3 going out without this?

A heads up that AFAICS changing ruby to not use timeouts here is a somewhat-significant change. (It needs an algorithm change to https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/9986. Currently, the short timeouts are needed in order for timely GC of channels and cleanup on interrupts). 

WIP on it, I think it's doable to change around ruby but there's some issues that still need to be fixed.

FTR, there does seem to be a real bug here:

WIP but seems its getting a bit more complicated, cc @jtattermusch because of the C# PR waiting on this

The phenomenon that seems to occur when tests fail is:
1. we start a watch with a timeout, which enqueues a closure to register a "watcher"
2. the timeout goes off and it runs it's watcher-cancelling-callback before that "watcher" has registered, but there's nothing to cancel, and things stop proceeding...
`tools/run_tests/run_tests.py -l c -r concurrent_connectivity_test -c asan -n inf -a 20` is the test that would previously fail, but it now seems to run forever, as head does.
heads up still not completely ready here though
